metadata.feature_description: Shows most popular content across the community with view counts and engagement metrics

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View popular content for different time periods

steps.action: Navigate to PersonaBar > Dashboard > Community Analytics
steps.expected: Community Analytics page loads with content type tabs and time period controls
steps.actual: Community Analytics page loaded successfully showing Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki tabs with date range picker and Comparative Term dropdown

steps.action: View Popular Content section for Answers content type
steps.expected: Popular Content section displays with content list or empty state message
steps.actual: Popular Content section displayed with 'No popular content available in selected period' message (empty state)

steps.action: Change Comparative Term dropdown from '1 w' to '1 m'
steps.expected: Comparative Term updates and data refreshes
steps.actual: Comparative Term dropdown successfully changed to '1 m' and data refreshed

steps.action: Switch to Blogs content type tab
steps.expected: Blogs analytics section displays with Popular Content
steps.actual: Blogs section displayed with separate Popular Content area showing empty state

steps.action: Change Comparative Term to '1 y' (1 year)
steps.expected: Comparative Term updates to yearly comparison
steps.actual: Comparative Term successfully changed to '1 y' for yearly comparison

steps.action: Click on date range to open time period picker
steps.expected: Time period options menu appears with Day, Week, Month, Year, Custom options
steps.actual: Time period dropdown appeared with Day, Week (selected), Month, Year, Custom options

steps.expected: Date range changes to 1 month period and charts update
steps.actual: Date range changed from '2 Feb 2026 - 8 Feb 2026' to '9 Jan 2026 - 8 Feb 2026' (1 month), Comparative Term auto-updated to '1 m', chart X-axis updated with daily intervals

steps.action: Locate pagination controls in Popular Content section
steps.expected: Pagination controls (prev/next) visible when content exceeds page size of 5 items
steps.actual: No pagination controls visible because Popular Content section displays 'No popular content available in selected period' - no data to paginate

issues: Cannot test pagination - no content data available in test environment. Code review shows pagination exists with page size of 5 items (social-dashboard-instance.js:990) but requires actual content to display

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Click through to actual content items

steps.action: Attempt to click on content item in Popular Content list
steps.expected: Content item links to actual content page
steps.actual: Cannot test - Popular Content section shows 'No popular content available in selected period'. No content items to click.

issues: Cannot test click-through functionality - no content data available in test environment

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify view count display and accuracy

steps.action: Verify view counts displayed in Popular Content section
steps.expected: View counts displayed for each content item
steps.actual: Cannot verify - Popular Content section shows empty state with no content items or view counts to verify

issues: Cannot verify view count accuracy - no content data available in test environment. Code shows 'count' field with 'countTooltip' in pageActivities.js but requires data to display

steps.action: Verify content is sorted by popularity (view count)
steps.expected: Content items displayed in descending order of popularity
steps.actual: Cannot verify sorting - Popular Content section shows empty state. Code review confirms API returns popular content sorted by views (CommunityAnalyticsController.cs GetPopularContent endpoint)

issues: Cannot verify sorting - no content data available in test environment

steps.action: Verify Popular Content section exists for Answers content type
steps.expected: Popular Content section visible in Answers analytics
steps.actual: Popular Content section visible with 'No popular content available in selected period' message

steps.action: Verify Popular Content section exists for Blogs content type
steps.expected: Popular Content section visible in Blogs analytics
steps.actual: Popular Content section visible with empty state message for Blogs

steps.action: Verify all content type tabs available (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki)
steps.expected: All 6 content type tabs accessible with their own Popular Content sections
steps.actual: All 6 content type tabs present and accessible. Each has its own Popular Content section with empty state handling

steps.action: Verify empty state message when no popular content exists
steps.expected: User-friendly message displayed when no data available
steps.actual: Message 'No popular content available in selected period' displayed clearly in Popular Content section

steps.action: Verify empty state persists across different time periods
steps.expected: Empty state message updates appropriately when changing time periods
steps.actual: Empty state message displayed consistently across Week, Month, and Year time periods

steps.action: Verify empty state across different content types
steps.expected: Each content type shows appropriate empty state when no data
steps.actual: Verified Answers and Blogs both show 'No popular content available in selected period' message. UI code shows empty state placeholder images in pageActivities.js

observations: Test environment has no community content data (no questions, blogs, discussions, events, ideas, or wiki articles), so Popular Content sections consistently show empty state

Code review confirms Popular Content functionality exists with proper API endpoints (GetPopularContent in CommunityAnalyticsController.cs) and UI components (pageActivities.js with pagination support)
Pagination is implemented with page size of 5 items (social-dashboard-instance.js:990) and prev/next navigation, but cannot be tested without data
Time period filtering works correctly with options: Day, Week, Month, Year, and Custom date range
Comparative Term dropdown allows comparison with previous period (1 y, 1 m, 1 w, 1 d)
All 6 content types (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki) have their own Popular Content sections
The pageActivities.js component shows truncated labels with tooltips for long content titles (titleLength: 25 characters)
